case_vignette: A 10-month-old boy is brought to the clinic with a history of recurrent episodes of stridor and wheezing. His mother reports that his wheezing is exacerbated by crying, feeding, and flexion of the neck, and is relieved by extension of the neck. Occasionally he vomits after feeding.
question: What is the most likely diagnosis?

Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I've been having these noisy breathing sounds and sometimes I wheeze, especially when I cry, eat or if my neck is bent.
Have you had any coughing or shortness of breath along with these noisy breathing sounds?
Yes, I cough sometimes, and it feels hard to breathe when I make those noisy sounds.
Have you had any fever or difficulty swallowing?
No fever, but sometimes when I eat, it doesn't go down right.
Have you had any recent changes in your weight or appetite?
My mom hasn't said anything about my weight, but I do throw up sometimes after I eat.
Have you had any recent changes in your sleep patterns or energy levels?
I haven't been sleeping too well because of the breathing issues.
Have you had any recent changes in your activity level or exercise routine?
I'm just a baby, so I don't really have an exercise routine, but sometimes playing can be hard when my breathing acts up.
Have you had any recent changes in your environment or exposure to allergens?
My mom hasn't mentioned anything like that.
Have you had any recent changes in your medications or supplements?
I haven't been taking any new medicines or supplements.
Have you had any recent changes in your family history of allergies or respiratory issues?
My mom hasn't talked about any new allergies or breathing problems in the family.
Based on your symptoms, medical history, and family history, I would like to recommend a diagnosis of asthma.
